result.execSummary:
The defendant Latoya K Triblett was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Child Abuse-Recklessly Cause Harm, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.03(3)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Provide DNA sample and pay DNA surcharge during probation; failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment being entered. Pay all mandatory court costs, fees and surcharges during probation; failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment being entered. Court waived all non-mandatory court costs, fees and surcharges finding the defendant indigent. Cash bail applied.
Defendant is advised he/she is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms. Defendant is advised he/she is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored.

- Complete a parenting class.
- Complete an Anger Management Class.
- Mental Health Assessment and cooperate with any treatment deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Participate in individual therapy.
- Follow all orders of DMCPS and/or Children Court Orders.
- Contact with the victim will be as allowed through DMCPS.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Latoya K Triblett

records.addlTxt: filed.
Proposed Jury Instructions, filed.

Defendant Latoya K Triblett in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Jessica Ann Behling appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
  Final pretrial proceeded.  State's offer stated on the record.  Defense rejects State's offer.  Case remains in jury trial posture.  Case is adjourned to 9-19-22 at 8:30 am for Jury Trial.
Defense Motion In Limine, filed.
JusticePoint Supervision Report, filed.
Notice of Expert Testimony, filed.
State's Motion In Limine, filed.
filed.

Defendant Latoya K Triblett in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Jessica Ann Behling appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
Defense is requesting the no contact order be modifed for supervised visits with the victim for purposes of counseling. State does not object.  Court will allow supervised visitation for a theraputic relationship only at this time.  
Case remains scheduled for a final pretrial on 8-19-22 at 8:30 am and jury trial on 9-19-22 at 8:30 am.
JusticePoint Supervision Report, filed.
Case is scheduled for a bail motion on 7-2-22 at 8:30 am.  All parties agreed upon new court date via email.

Defendant Latoya K Triblett in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Jessica Ann Behling appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Latoya K Triblett appeared by video means with Attorney.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Status Conference held.  Defense counsel requests final pretrial and jury trial dates.  Case adjourned, Br. 10.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Supervision Report, filed.

Defendant Latoya K Triblett in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Jessica Ann Behling appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Latoya K Triblett appeared by video means with Attorney.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Scheduling Conference held.  Defense counsel requests additional status conference date.  Case adjourned, Br. 10.  Status conference scheduled for June 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Latoya K Triblett in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Michelle A. Grasso appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial. *Defense acknowledges receipt of the Information, waives reading and enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of his client.
  This hearing will be streamed live on DAcast:
https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/d84cd54a-763c-3a58-15a9-b84acf306616  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no contact with S.K.T.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Latoya K Triblett in court with attorney Travis Schwantes.  Defendant Latoya K Triblett in custody.  Alexandria S. Carlson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Latoya K Triblett appeared by video means with Attorney. Due to assignment of Assistant District Attorney, the defendant is advised that case is reassigned to Judge Havas Br 10.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Havas, Branch 10.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
